intro: Lasianthera membranacea, commonly known as the membranous lasianthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a membranous texture, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
